I feel it has mostly to do with his reload mechanic. He has a fair amount of counterplay regardless of how strong he is. Immobile, reloading after 4 shots, skill shot CC. I do not mind Jhin at all like you.

His 4th shot is also a big part of his damage and very telegraphed, making it very easy to time a shield or an Exhaust to reduce it's damage.

He's just overall amazingly well designed.

Also, damage nerfs among masteries don't change Jhin's strength because it affects all of the champions he's competing with as well. 

He. Needs. Nerfs. 

The only question is how large those nerfs should be, and whether it should be to damage or utility.

> Also, damage nerfs among masteries don't change Jhin's strength because it affects all of the champions he's competing with as well.

that's false, damage nerfs effect champions in different ways. We can expect these damage nerfs to actually be *buffs* to juggernauts and divers, because their targets don't have a lot of hp in the first place and their primary weakness right now is the inability to survive. High damage-dealers like ADCs (aka: Jhin) get nerfed by all the *% damage reductions* wayyy more than someone that only needs to dish out 1.5-2k damage to kill the target.

> He. Needs. Nerfs.

You've yet to explain why he needs nerfs...he's has been sitting at a 51-52% win ratio for the past 5+ patches. That's *consistence*. You know who else has been consistent? Amumu has had a 51-53% win rate for about 2 seasons now. Janna has had a 53%+ win rate for like, 10 seasons (I don't actually know but it's been awhile).

But because Amumu and Janna don't kill you fast, you don't think they're incredibly op. Because Jhin can burst you, you view that as "op" and inherently "game breaking" despite his consistent win-rate that shows the champion itself is only slightly above everyone else.

Basically, you hate how he wins but you don't actually hate how often he wins, otherwise you'd be complaining about wayyy more applicable champs in terms of win-rate and consistency.

Agreed. Jhin's winrate is high because non-utility ADC's are just garbage currently, when you discard the champs like kog-maw who are doing well, but played mostly by mains. If you buffed up the weaker ADC's you would see his winrate fall, because currently none of the meta ADC's can punish him really hard in lane, because they are all just utility

the problem is consistency with high play rate

a higher play rate = both bad and good players are picking it up
but, staying consistent and up in win ratio despite high number of players picking him up shows that this champion is strong enough so that even tho newer players gona naturally suck, the others are gona be very good with him

what I personally dislike about his is his slow traps. And just that. Fine, his range is absurd, but that's his "trope" and "niche"

>The only question is how large those nerfs should be, and whether it should be to damage or utility.

If it's going to be targeting his utility then they need to hit his utility hard, not the slow nerfs on the PBE, they ultimately won't do enough. You need to start hitting his W, it's an ultimate spell in terms of power budgeting right now. It's not OK for a champ to have a base spell that snares for 1.75 seconds at Jhin's W range. If Jhin doesn't hit the target himself the W should either be a strong slow for 1.75 or a snare for half that IMO.

A 1.75 second snare at Rank 5, meaning if he wants that early game, he loses the wave clear and extra damage for his Q. It also has a delay time, meaning it can be easily dodged (unless you want to head into the Chain CC argument, when ANYONE can do that). 

If he wants to use it as an escape, he has to auto, and then wait an entire Solid Cast time for it to go through it's wind-up and delay. By picking Jhin, you choose to pick a Carry whose primary target is squishies instead of tanks, and since he is much more mage-like than most adc's, that lack of DPS is made up for in Utility.
